item.title: Presentations
item.author: gdrnbody@lct.jussieu.fr
item.description: Keynote speakers Paola Gori-Giorgi (Vrije Universiteit, Amsterdam) Large-coupling strength expansion in DFT and Hartree-Fock adiabatic connections In this talk I will review and put into perspective several results on the large-coupling strength expansion of two adiabatic connections (AC) widely used in electronic structure theory. The first one is the density fixed [1] AC of DFT that connects the Kohn-Sham determinant with the physical state. Its large-coupling strength limit defines a multimarginal optimal transport problem [2-4], also known in physics as the strictly-correlated-electrons (SCE) functional [5-7].
